question.title: Will a National Rally–labeled list win the mayoralty of at least one of Marseille, Lyon, or Toulouse in France’s 2026 municipal elections ?
question.description:
This tracks whether RN converts national-level support into executive control in a major city, which is strategically important for legitimacy, patronage, and media salience.

`{"format":"bot_tournament_question","info":{"hash_id":"82fe4c6ed29cf136","sheet_id":210.1}}`
question.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as “Yes” if the official municipal results published show that the winning mayoral list in at least one of Marseille, Lyon, or Toulouse is labeled/nuanced as National Rally (Rassemblement National, “RN”) on the French Ministry of the Interior elections site or [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions).
question.fine_print: This resolves based on the final outcome of the municipal election (including second round if held). If the Ministry site uses a “nuance” code, treat RN-coded lists as qualifying; do not include broader far-right labels unless explicitly RN-coded. If all three cities’ winning lists are not RN-labeled, resolve “No”.
question.short_title: Will a National Rally–labeled list win the mayoralty of at least one of Marseille, Lyon, or Toulouse
